alert.note: Alert for Lower Kuskokwim Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 10 at 4:13PM AKST until December 11 at 5:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM AKST MONDAY FROM SLEETMUTE EAST... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Visibility reduced to one half mile at times. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches. Northerly winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Lower Kuskokwim Valley, from Sleetmute east. * WHEN...Until 5 AM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow and blowing snow will spread north from Bristol Bay this evening. The heaviest snowfall amounts are currently expected for Lime Village, with lower amounts further west. Winds and snow intensity decrease Monday morning, ending the threat of half mile visibilities, though light snow continues through at least Monday evening.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
